units.title: High-resolution clustering and annotation
units.text: We clustered cells at high resolution in each dataset and assigned cell annotations based on known marker gene expression and differential expression between clusters (Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise process for clustering and labeling cells.

units.title: Assessment of data-integration methods
units.text: We assessed 12 different data-integration methods using the proportion of cell types in each organoid sample and compared the similarity of each cell type with counterparts in adult and fetal tissues and selected scPoli to generate an integrated embedding of all organoid cells.
units.rationale: Outlines the systematic evaluation and selection of an integration method.

units.title: Pseudo-bulk variance analysis
units.text: Pseudo-bulk analysis using both raw and scPoli embedding on all organoid single-cell datasets revealed stem cell source and tissue type as primary drivers of variance.
units.rationale: Specifies a quantitative analysis step to identify major sources of variation.

units.title: Cytokine treatment of ileum organoids
units.text: We treated ASC-derived ileum organoids with these cytokines for 24 h and performed scRNA-seq on control (4,191 cells) and treated samples from the same batch (viral response, 3,305 cells; inflammation, 2,158 cells).
units.rationale: Provides a clear experimental protocol for cytokine exposure and sequencing.

units.title: Projection onto HEOCA atlas
units.text: We projected each organoid sample onto the integrated HEOCA through HEOCA projection and annotation revealed diverse cell types including stem cells, enterocytes, goblet cells and enteroendocrine cells.
units.rationale: Details the step of mapping new samples onto a reference atlas.

units.title: Distance-to-atlas comparison
units.text: Distance-to-atlas analysis revealed that, compared with the control sample, both viral response and inflammation samples had higher distances in all cell types.
units.rationale: Describes a comparative metric to assess perturbation effects.

units.title: Generation of ASC-derived ileal organoids with TNF/RANKL
units.text: We generated ASC-derived ileal organoids in control media or media supplemented with TNF and RANKL, and performed scRNA-seq after 6 days of treatment.
units.rationale: Specifies a protocol for organoid culture under specific cytokine conditions.

units.title: Integration of lung organoid reference atlas
units.text: We integrated a unified reference of primary adult and fetal lung tissues consisting of 221,425 cells obtained from 52 samples and 13 publications, and integrated lung organoid data to generate a human lung organoid cell atlas (HLOCA).
units.rationale: Summarizes the creation of a comprehensive lung organoid reference.

units.title: Hierarchical cell-type annotation
units.text: We mapped organoid cell types to a primary tissue reference atlas by label-aware integration, establishing a three-level hierarchical cell-type annotation: class (level 1), type (level 2) and subtype (level 3).
units.rationale: Defines the structured annotation scheme used for cell types.

units.title: scIBD meta-analysis application
units.text: We applied scIBD: Single-cell meta analysis to assess organoid perturbation states.
units.rationale: Indicates the use of a specific tool for metaâ€‘analysis of perturbation data.
